intro: Phlomoides nuda, commonly known as the naked phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, pale blue or purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or dry landscapes.
